meanings.definition: A person who executes a will with another person.
meanings.sent1: The coexecutors worked together to carry out the wishes of the deceased.
meanings.sent2: The lawyer appointed two coexecutors to handle the distribution of the estate.
meanings.sent3: The coexecutors joked about needing a map to navigate the legal paperwork.
meanings.sent4: Being coexecutors felt like being part of a team with a shared goal.
meanings.sent5: The responsibility of being coexecutors weighed heavily on their shoulders.

meanings.definition: Two or more persons who execute a will together.
meanings.sent1: The coexecutors signed the necessary documents in unison.
meanings.sent2: It is common for siblings to be named as coexecutors in a will.
meanings.sent3: The coexecutors playfully argued over who would get the bigger share of the inheritance.
meanings.sent4: The bond between coexecutors is like a legal partnership.
meanings.sent5: The presence of coexecutors ensures the will is executed fairly and accurately.
